body:
I think you misunderstood something.

If you installed the package using drat, everything is done.

You don't need to do anything more.
Thank you for your potential helps. Looking forward to your great contribution. @sxjscience

try update your mxnet to latest version

I simplify the code further, nothing to do with sequence length

```
import mxnet as mx

def sym_gen(length):
    data = mx.sym.Variable('data')
    hidden = mx.sym.Variable('hidden')
    for i in range(length):
        hidden = hidden + data
    return hidden
sym = sym_gen(length=20000)
del sym
```
Unlike in scenarios like gbm, it is not possible to support this option in deep nets

This is an interesting problem that raises up. This was due to the usage of shared_ptr inside the symbol and the deletion triggered a chain of shared_ptr deletions, where the recursion of delete function call piles up and causes stack overflow. 

Like @sxjscience said, remove the delete of symbol might be a good temp solution to go. We will think of better alternatives for a safer destruction.

Thanks for finding this interesting case. Also  cc @mavenlin since it is interesting thing we need to address in pressure testing the graph.
should be fixed by https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/2586
breaking all previous models seems really bad...
Only break Inception family. I have fixed symbols and pretrained model.
does it affect vgg?
I think vgg is ok
@tqchen @piiswrong please check this. If it is ok we can merge this first because it fix travis.
Thanks for the fix, it works now...

@Yang507  you can download Xerox.ttf from http://www.webpagepublicity.com/free-fonts/x/Xerox%20Sans%20Serif%20Narrow.ttf and put it in ./data/

Can you paster all error messages?
Oh, I see. My mxnet was installed months ago. The 'module' was added long after my installation. Thank you.
closed #2582
Why is the module interface added, for the convenience of multiple devices?
you can refer to https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/tree/master/scala-package
Now it works for lstm 2. Another more pretty approach to fix it is to modify io.py which is not compatible with previous written iters as provieded_type is not defined before.
Yes, actually I built all my other librairies with MinGW. If you don't mind, I am interested in a way to build MXNet that way. Thanks.

the scheduler,server,worker can start up.
but when I use such code in the worker procces,

```
kvs = mx.kv.create('dist_sync')
#kvs._set_updater(update)
...
kvs.push(3,mx.nd.ones(2))
```

the server will crash with:

```
    import mxnet as mx

```

I think there is something wrong with my usage, I want to run two worker and share some value by kvstore. but the push value step not work, how can I do it?

You're right, you have to manually change mxnet_predict-all.cc setting MSHADOW_USE_SSE to 0.

In the guide I put this:

Change

```
#if defined(__ANDROID__) || defined(__MXNET_JS__)
#define MSHADOW_USE_SSE         0
#endif
```

To

```
#define MSHADOW_USE_SSE         0
```
@gaush123 You can also try swig.

The reason I don't recommend using MinGW is the different distributions of MinGW are somewhat inconsistent with each other and normally I build MinGW by myself.

From your log, maybe you can comment out the line below and try again.

https://github.com/dmlc/dmlc-core/blob/master/include/dmlc/base.h#L114

BTW, please use `make` not `make -j4`. We can have a more clear log in case you met new problems

The first one is a warning. It's safe to ignore it.

you need android sdk for building with android
@antinucleon

I think it is `fix_gamma`'s issue. I have updated one but not all.

can you give two hashtags of versions that we can compare on? So it is faster for others to reproduce if it is the problem. Thanks

it is the latest version, i just download a day ago,  the previous version is Dec,2015,i don't remember.

the problem is that the *\* when i train on GPU, CPU use is 100%**, so the GPU load is very unstable.

again, it would be nice if you can give two hashtags from commit history https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/commits/master to help reproduce this problem so it can be investigated in   more detailed way

There are some CPU usages on preprocessors for max throughput so maybe it pressures servers with few cores, here are some possibilities:
-  The Enable of OpenMP in this line, you can try rebuild by removing this line https://github.com/hjk41/mshadow/blob/12299cb06edea97678be96ea359bca5172fe2362/mshadow/tensor_cpu-inl.h#L145
- The number of preprocessing threads in your ImageRecordIter, preprocess_threads which can be reduced
@livedimg we can discuss in that repos.

the latest is: commit 048546d6aff3cd61a5d15755b3a33c936e9f3211

the previous  i don't have the repo,  i just download the zip. sorry  
because the previous version don't have the module and share_mem excutor, so i update.
You mean the system level nvidia driver crashes? This sounds like a cuda/cudnn bug. Let's confirm and report to them.
your batch_size is smaller than the number of gpus you are using. Some gpus cannot get data

I tried to comment out the line you specified. I was functional for my previous error. Unfortunately I ran into another error.. I am afraid building with MinGW is impossible 
[err.txt](https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/files/344443/err.txt)
thanks for your tips. i remove the line 145   *_#pragma omp parallel for *_ and the program run well the cifar10 speed is 500+sample/sec on titanx with cudnn v3. the cpu use is stable.

i also have a problem. when i USE_CUDNN(cudnn v3), train cifar10, thespeed is 500+sample/sec, but when train a FCN model, the loss operator  i write by **numpyOP**, the speed only 0.15 sample/sec.
if i don't use cudnn, train cifar10, the speed only 400 sample/sec, but train my FCN model, the speed is   3.0 samples/sec.  i don't known why

the previous mxnet version (0.5.0)version, i don't use cudnn just follow the bappynear's set, train cifar10 speed is 500+ samples/sec, train my FCN model is 2.8 samples/sec.

Using MinGW, you can only compile the CPU version. This is the constraint from Nividia. Not from us.
@piiswrong  Thank you, but why inception can work but Alexnet and VGG cannot with all same parameters?
please try the python version
your loaded parameters doesn't match the network you defined

@piiswrong  Yes, I want  to change the last FC layer from 1008 to 10.
I tried this way:

```
model = mx.model.FeedForward.load('../tmp/model/Inception-7', 1, ctx=devs)  
print model.arg_params['fc1_weight'].asnumpy().shape

model_new = mx.model.FeedForward.load('./save/inception-v3', 1)
for name, arr in model_new.arg_params.items():
    if 'fc' not in name:
        model_new.arg_params[name] = model.arg_params[name]
    else:
        print arr.asnumpy().shape, model.arg_params[name].asnumpy().shape
```

Then I tried to fit the network:

```
eval_metrics = ['accuracy']

batch_end_callback = []
batch_end_callback.append(mx.callback.Speedometer(batch, 50))
checkpoint = mx.callback.do_checkpoint('save/inception-v3-finetune')
eval_metrics = ['accuracy']

model_new.fit(
    X                  = train,
    eval_data          = val,
    eval_metric        = eval_metrics,
    kvstore            = kv,
    batch_end_callback = batch_end_callback,
    epoch_end_callback = checkpoint)
```

Could you help me to find you why?
Another problem is that, how to change the learning rate for convolutional layer?

It's impossible to assign a (1008,2048) matrix to a (10,2048) matrix. You need to init from random. Use mx.init.Mixed.
Per layer learning rate can be set with attr={'lr_mult': '0.01'} in that layer

WindowsError: [Error 126]
This is usually because the dependent dll not find.So, you can:
1.use the 'Depends' tools open the libmxnet.dll, see which dll is missing.
2.make sure the u have the dll in your machine, and add the environment-path.

try git pull && git submodule update && make clean && make
@thirdwing Could you verify if removing L92 fixes this? I'm not sure why. Alternatively try add fix_gamma=False to all your bn symbols in json

If you want to use cpu, simply omit the '--gpus' argument
you can duplicate it for n times

Hi @sxjscience , I have fixed the above mentioned problems. 
However, when I run the code with GPU, it will stuck at:

```
Summary of dataset ==================
bucket of (1, 1) : 1550 samples
bucket of (6, 6) : 7556 samples
bucket of (11, 11) : 7477 samples
bucket of (16, 16) : 7308 samples
bucket of (21, 21) : 6109 samples
01:43:31 INFO:Start training with [gpu(0)]
```

@yuantangliang You need to write backward logic manually for custom layers. Backward pass is automatic only if you are able to build the loss function using basic MXNet symbols (http://mxnet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/packages/python/symbol.html).
